anywhere you can find one of the things
we like is water
Boise City a small town in the Oklahoma
Panhandle has seen its fair share of
hard times
in the 1930s billowing dust storms
forced residents to flee to the west
coast
for decades after those that remained in
this small farming community steeled
themselves against the ravages of
weather and dry earth as a result of the
drought like a planted wheat but it
never did come up but with the dwindling
population and lack of economic
opportunities and historic drought is
poised to do what the Dust Bowl couldn't
drive towns in his parched region out of
existence the young folks didn't find
occupation there so they moved away and
that's just not available here and won't
be available with our water we have hard
times but any place you go you're going
to have some adversity if you could live
anywhere in the world where would you
live here already got my grave picked
out
a big portion of our population dropped
is married right out here we've buried
them and there's nobody here to replace
them as far as their day-to-day lives
there's nothing they can do about the
weather and they know it like say when
we came out I didn't notice the wind
blowing because it's just a normal day
for us it's a fact of life it blows my
family and I stay here this is where
we've lived this is where we've been
happy things happen here and I would
assume in other small towns around the
country that don't happen other places
so that's why we stay here and that's
why we will do whatever it takes to stay
here as long as we possibly can what we
need is some sort of diverse economy to
come in here we keep hoping for wind
powers because God helpless we got wind
leak without jobs in a tax base it's
like a pants pocket with full of sand
and a hole the size of your little
finger in the corner and it's just all
he can away and unless we can get
something it's going to eventually be
gone
this ranch is approximately 15,000 acres
in this semi arid country as you can see
there's not much degrees out here if it
rains it grows if it doesn't rain it
doesn't grow and we should be turning
